Curriculum Vitae
Name :	Jerôme Jacques Ganachaud
Current Role : 	Capital Program / Projects Analysis Specialist
Qualifications :	MBA – Swiss Business School
Bachelor of Science – University of Cape Town, South Africa
Chartered Chemical Engineer – Member of Institute of Chemical Engineers
Postgraduate Diploma in Marketing Management – University of South Africa
Experience Summary
26 years’ experience working in the oil, gas and energy, chemicals, and mining industries.
Key roles held include Project Director, Senior Project Manager, Works and Engineering Manager.
Leading teams for analysing and advising for Projects, Acquisitions and Joint Ventures.
Experience leading mega projects with teams of 300+ professional engineers and 6000+ site labour.
Interim management roles to “rescue” projects Curriculum Vitae
Name :	Jerôme Jacques Ganachaud
Current Role : 	Capital Program / Projects Analysis Specialist
Qualifications :	MBA – Swiss Business School
Bachelor of Science – University of Cape Town, South Africa
Chartered Chemical Engineer – Member of Institute of Chemical Engineers
Postgraduate Diploma in Marketing Management – University of South Africa
Experience Summary
26 years’ experience working in the oil, gas and energy, chemicals, and mining industries.
Key roles held include Project Director, Senior Project Manager, Works and Engineering Manager.
Leading teams for analysing and advising for Projects, Acquisitions and Joint Ventures.
Experience leading mega projects with teams of 300+ professional engineers and 6000+ site labour.
Interim management roles to “rescue” projects.
Commercially and financially astute, produced and managed budgets and schedules with direct P&L responsibilities.
Strong interpersonal skills and confident communication at all levels.
Supported business development with proposals and maintaining / strengthening ongoing relationships.
Strong bias for HSE with proven reductions in reportable accidents to zero.
Global experience - South Korea, Saudi Arabia, Oman, Europe, North America, South Africa, India.
Implemented software solutions to optimize project and business processes.
Experience Details
Saudi Aramco (Dhahran, Saudi Arabia)
March 2015 – present
Capital Program Analysis Specialist – Values Range to $ Multi Billion
I am one of a small group of senior leaders reporting directly to the Senior Vice President, and working within the Project Management Organisation. My role is to analyse and advise on the capital program of projects to help steer the individual project managers/engineers and consequently advise senior management for key decisions such as business viability and strategic fit, funding, organisation, procurement and contracting options, technical completeness and finally risks and readiness to proceed.
The capital portfolio ranges from small to mega projects for Company, Joint Ventures, Acquisitions and government strategic projects. Most projects within the program are executed on a lump sum turnkey and lump sum procure build basis.
I served as a core team member to design and implement an Oracle based Enterprise Project Management system now utilized throughout the capital program; and; consistently work within teams to optimize the processes for project execution.
Jacobs Engineering (Reading, UK)
November 2014 – March 2015
Engineering Manager – BP Khazzan Project, Oman – Multi Billion
Requested to be an interim manager to drive the detailed engineering delivery. My scope included developing a new budget, enhancing project controls reporting and ensuring teams were suitably resourced. The Client requested for me to join the project on a permanent basis and move with the project to Oman to manage the delivery of the engineering from in-house and subcontractors based in the UK, India, and UAE offices. My team included approximately 250 engineers.
July 2014 – October 2014
Project Director – Coryton, UK, Refinery Conversion (JV - Shell, Greenergy, Vopak)
A politically complex yet smaller project where I was asked to assume the leadership of the existing site team for finalising the detail design and construction work packages for the conversion of the refinery to a bulk storage terminal. This project was cancelled due to funding issues.
December 2009 – June 2014
Project Director / Senior Project Manager- $2B Power and Water Facility Saudi Arabia
Marafiq Yanbu 2 project produces 690MWe, 60,000m3/day of potable and process water, and 150,000m3/h of seawater cooling for the local Yanbu industrial city and interfaces with Saudi Aramco facilities.
I led this project from concept through to construction completion.
In addition to initial standard project execution activities such as FEED and Request for Proposal development, my role included business case development, project and operations budget forecasts, Marafiq board presentations, prequalification of bidders, economic evaluations, contractor selection and contract negotiations for five LSTK Contracts.
My role included coo

Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
